meanings.definition: Officially declaring someone to be a saint in the Roman Catholic Church.
meanings.sent1: The canonising of Mother Teresa brought joy to many believers.
meanings.sent2: The canonising ceremony was attended by a large crowd of faithful followers.
meanings.sent3: The town celebrated the canonising of their local hero with a grand parade.
meanings.sent4: The canonising of historical figures can inspire future generations.
meanings.sent5: The process of canonising requires thorough investigation and evidence.
